description: A visualized application for homology-based gene searching and plotting using multiple reference sequences.
name: ReGSP

metadata.abstract: Copyright 2021 Ejigu et al.The massively parallel nature of next-generation sequencing technologies has con- tributed to the generation of massive sequence data in the last two decades. Deciphering the meaning of each generated sequence requires multiple analysis agents, at all stages of analysis, from the reads stage all the way up to the whole-genome level. Homology- based approaches based on related reference sequences are usually the preferred option for gene and transcript prediction in newly sequenced genomes, resulting in the popularity of a variety of BLAST and BLAST-based agents. For organelle genomes, a single-reference-based gene finding agent that uses grouping parameters for BLAST results has been implemented in the Genome Search Plotter (GSP). However, this agent does not accept multiple and user-customized reference sequences required for a broad homology search. Here, we present multiple Reference-based Gene Search and Plot (ReGSP), a simple and convenient web agent that accepts multiple reference sequences for homology-based gene search. The agent incorporates cPlot, a novel dot plot agent, for illustrating nucleotide sequence similarity between the query and the reference sequences.
metadata.title: ReGSP: A visualized application for homology-based gene searching and plotting using multiple reference sequences
